entry.title: Duluth, MN
entry.content: Decided to fly around Duluth, MN. Started at the airport and eventually crashed as Bong airport lol.

entry.title: Reykjavik, Iceland
entry.content:
This request is in Iceland! I decided to check out the capitol since I didn't know where to start and now I want to visit lol.

Had a bit of a weird landing because people were parked on the runway for some reason I guess?? I survived though.

entry.title: Minneapolis Covered in Smoke from Canada
entry.content:
Biked home from work and saw downtown looked like a sci-fi film. Decided to see how grim the situation looked from the sky in flight sim.

Let's just say that climate change is pretty crazy, huh.

Shout out to East Phillips Neighborhood Institute. They recently won an inspiring victory to repurpose a local roof depot into indigenous lead, sustainable community space focused on meeting human needs. If we're gonna survive the future (big if at that), it probably looks something like that and you should know about it because the news isn't gonna tell you how we solve this. Only grassroots organizing will.

Last shots are a clear skies comparison.

entry.title: Victoria Falls
entry.content:
Another waterfall request, this time in Victoria Falls, Zimbabwe.

Pretty impressive elevation depth, even if it looks wonky up close sometimes lol. Do recommend.

entry.title: Fez, Morocco
entry.content: My partner requested this one! Had some fun taking shots with a jet.

entry.title: Iguazu Falls
entry.content:
This week's request was for Iguazu Falls! Located near the borders of Argentina, Paraguay and Uruguay in Misiones, Argentina.

Looks pretty good from far away, but admittedly flight sim gets wonky with waterfalls if you get close lol.

Still pretty fun to see though.

entry.title: Potato River, WI
entry.content:
A buddy of mine recommended taking a flight around the Potato River in Wisconsin. I took off from Spud River Landing Strip. First I went north to get a good view of Lake Superior then turned south to follow the river into the farm lands below.

I'm sure the beauty of the river itself doesn't come across quite like real life, but hey just a good excuse to see it!

I used this as testing grounds for capturing better screenshots so you might notice these are better quality too.

entry.title: Sitka, Alaska
entry.content:
On my snapchat story the same day that I released Ludo Air someone else was traveling in Sitka, Alaska and they recommended that I check it out.

So here it is!

entry.title: Spooky Home Tour
entry.content:
This post has a music video! See: ludoloon.studio for download!

Right click, or long press on mobile, while in the photo viewer to download any photos.

At the recommendation of a friend I flew around back home to get some pictures. Here's Rice Lake & Mikana, WI! (and some awesome shots of Long Lake).

Weather was set to live, but the time was moved earlier so the footage wouldn't be too dark to see. It was a windy night which made flying interesting to say the least.

I started from Rice Lake Airport then headed North, accidentally followed M and went to Long Lake. From there I made my way to Angus which put me back on track to go South Down 48 to Mikana. I was snapchatting some friends who wanted to see Rice Lake so I made it a whole double tour lol.

From Mikana I headed back towards Rice Lake down 48 southbound until I overshot and hit Oakdale Rd back to take me westbound into town. Got some more shots after the clouds rolled in. Eventually made my way back to the airport.

entry.title: Auckland, New Zealand
entry.content:
These photos were captured as part of a series to get footage for some new music videos. So far I haven't made any new music videos, but the footage made for some great photos!

This trip was a simple landing coming in to Auckland, New Zealand. The landing was a bit rough but the view was great!

entry.title: Rural Canada
entry.content:
These photos were captured as part of a series to get footage for some new music videos. So far I haven't made any new music videos, but the footage made for some great photos!

I believe they were taken somewhere in south east Canada. I don't remember the exact location. Enjoy!

entry.title: Hiroshima, Japan
entry.content:
These photos were captured as part of a series to get footage for some new music videos. So far I haven't made any new music videos, but the footage made for some great photos!

Looking around the map for inspiration, I saw Hiroshima. We learn about how the atomic bomb was dropped there, so naturally I was curious to see what the city "actually" looks like today (virtually anyway). Plus I wanted to get a sense of scale for how big the city is.

I took off from the Iwakuni air base just a few miles south of the city itself. The whole trip was quite beautiful... and terrifying.

entry.title: New York City, New York
entry.content:
These photos were captured as part of a series to get footage for some new music videos. So far I haven't made any new music videos, but the footage made for some great photos!

It's always a fun time flying around New York, especially at night to make it extra moody. The scale of the buildings, the size of the city, it's a lot to take in. Highly recommend.

entry.title: Up North
entry.content:
These photos were captured as part of a series to get footage for some new music videos. So far I haven't made any new music videos, but the footage made for some great photos!

Super pleased with the photos I got from the trip. I believe it was from somewhere in Michigan, but I don't know where exactly. The moody purple lighting mixed with the landing by the lighthouse and the massive lake is just too beautiful.

entry.title: The First Ludo Air Gallery!
entry.content:
Hello everyone!

I created this website to demo my web design abilities and show off my flight sim adventures. Here's a variety pack of photos that I used for testing purposes. It's got a variety of good shots from the footage I've taken over the years.
